longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and/or passport replacing documents must be valid
  on arrival.
 - Emergency and temporary passports must be valid for the
   period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of Birth certificate and photo I.D., issued to those
  eligible to hold British passports.
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 6 months:
 - for holders of British passports (SEE NOTE 26659).
     NOTE 26659: Max. stay of 3 months is only permitted to
    holders of British passports when they enter with a Birth
    Certificate and an Official Photo ID. Exempt are holders
    of British passports issued in Montserrat endorsed
     British Overseas Territories Citizen  or  British
    Overseas Citizen . 
Minors:
- British Minors (except those of Montserrat status) under the
  age of 16, who are not in possession of an official photo
  ID, are required to present additional proof of identity
  (e.g. a school photo ID).
Additional Information:
- If nationality is not indicated in the Identification Card,
  a Birth Certificate is required.
- Visitors are required to hold documents required for their
  next destination. (SEE NOTE 44705)
    NOTE 44705: Not applicable to those born in Grenada and
   holding proof thereof. 
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry. (SEE NOTE 44705)
    NOTE 44705: Not applicable to those born in Grenada and
   holding proof thereof
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission within 12 hours provided not leaving the
  transit areas. 
- Children under 1 year of age.
